newsitem.title: USA: Synopsys cuts Cooper & Chyan stake.
newsitem.headline: Synopsys cuts Cooper & Chyan stake.

text.p: Synopsys Inc on Wednesday said it cut its stake in Cooper & Chyan Technologies Inc to 988,361 common shares, or 7.6 percent of the total outstanding.
Previously, Synopsys said it held 1,206,542 shares, or 9.9 percent.
In a filing with the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission, Synopsys said it sold 218,181 Cooper & Chyan shares beween December 16, 1996, and January 24, 1997, for a net profit of $4 million.
Synopsys said it sold the shares as part of a program of regular divestment.
The company noted that it had publicly announced its intention to sell shares in each fiscal quarter in an amount that would yield a profit of $2.0 million per quarter.
It said the share sales reported on Wednesday reflect the first two quarters of such sales.
